title: 'Law must take its course': King Charles on arrest of his brother Andrew amid Epstein probe
content: King Charles III expressed deep concern and stated "the law must take its course" following the arrest of his brother, ex-prince Andrew, on suspicion of misconduct in public office. The investigation into allegations of sharing confidential trade documents with Jeffrey Epstein will proceed with full cooperation from the royal family.

title: King Charles 'not informed' in advance of ex-prince Andrew's arrest - what we know
content: Prince Andrew was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office on his 66th birthday, following alleged links to the Epstein Files. Thames Valley Police raided the Sandringham estate after emails and compromising photographs emerged from US Department of Justice releases. Prime Minister Keir Starmer stated no one is above the law.

title: How AI uncovered Rs 70,000 crore tax evasion scam starting with Hyderabad biryani chains
content: An Income Tax investigation into Hyderabad biryani chains uncovered a massive tax evasion scam across India's food and beverage industry. Analyzing 60 terabytes of data from a pan-India billing software, officials revealed suppressed sales turnover of at least Rs 70,000 crore since 2019-20. The probe identified deletion and under-reporting of cash transactions as key evasion tactics.

title: 'International cricket will expose you': Amir tears into Abhishek Sharma again
content: Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir has issued a stark warning to India's Abhishek Sharma following his three consecutive ducks in the T20 World Cup 2026. Amir drew parallels to Saim Ayub's early struggles, emphasizing how quality bowlers exploit technical flaws.

title: Thala for a reason? Shivam Dube credits 'Mahi bhai' after match-winning knock
content: Shivam Dube credited MS Dhoni's guidance for his improved batting approach, particularly against pace. Dhoni advised focusing on strike rotation and controlled intent, which Dube implemented effectively in India's T20 World Cup win against the Netherlands. Dube's match-winning 67-run knock and two wickets earned him player of the match honors.

title: What OpenAI CEO said about awkward moment with Anthropic CEO at India AI Summit going viral
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman addressed an awkward onstage moment at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, where he and Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei appeared to hesitate during a group photo with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Altman stated he was confused about the expected pose, mistaking it for an 'open clock' gesture.

title: ‚ÄòJust bed and toilet‚Äô: No royal privileges for arrested ex-prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor
content: Britain's former prince Andrew has been arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office and faces no special treatment in custody, with experts stating he can be held for up to 96 hours. The arrest is linked to his association with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, with revelations suggesting he shared confidential documents while serving as a trade envoy.

title: Mahua Moitra moves Delhi HC against ex-partner seeking custody of pet Rottweiler 'Henry'
content: TMC MP Mahua Moitra has approached the Delhi High Court seeking custody of her pet Rottweiler, Henry. The plea challenges a lower court's order that denied her monthly 10-day custody. The dispute with her ex-partner, Jai Anant Dehadrai, over the dog has escalated into public and legal confrontations.

title: 35 students found with wrist cuts in Chhattisgarh govt school; probe ordered
content: Alarm bells rang in Chhattisgarh's Dhamtari district after 35 students from a government middle school were found with healed cut marks on their wrists. The injuries, believed to be weeks old, surfaced after a parent's complaint. Preliminary investigations suggest peer imitation, with students using sharp objects, possibly influenced by a dare or social media trend.

title: Ex-prince Andrew arrested: What recent files revealed about his ties with Epstein
content: Prince Andrew was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office following new documents linking him to Jeffrey Epstein. These files include photographs and emails suggesting Andrew shared trade reports and discussed meetings with women. Several UK police forces are now reviewing material related to his association with the convicted sex offender.

title: Volkswagen Tayron R-Line launched at Rs 46.99 lakh: What makes it special
content: Features include a fully digital instrument cluster, a panoramic sunroof, customisable ambient lighting with up to 30 colour options, and Matrix LED lighting technology. In terms of practicality, the SUV offers up to 850 litres of boot space with the third row folded down. The Tayron is powered by a 2.0-litre, 4-cylinder, turbocharged petrol engine that produces 204 hp and 320 Nm of torque.

title: Why Zuckerberg's Meta is betting on election investments to promote politicians?
content: Meta is reportedly planning its largest election spending, aiming for $65 million to back state-level candidates supporting the AI industry. The social media giant is establishing new political groups to influence emerging AI regulations, with initial efforts focused on Texas and Illinois. This move signals a significant shift in Meta's political engagement strategy.

title: ‚ÄòMy BP was 160‚Äô: How he left his job and built Rs 30 lakh farming venture
content: An engineer quit his high-paying IT job to pursue organic moringa farming in Haryana after lifestyle diseases impacted his health.  Jitender and Sarla Mann now run a successful business, earning ‚Çπ30 lakh annually from organic moringa products sold across India, the USA, and the UAE, emphasizing quality and chemical-free practices.

title: Ramadan 2026: When is first Roza in India? check Sehri and Iftar timings in Delhi
content: India observes the sacred month of Ramazan starting February 19, 2026, with Muslims fasting from dawn till dusk until March 19. This period involves prayer, charity, and community meals, culminating in the Eid-Al-Fitr celebration.  The article provides specific Sehri and Iftar timings for Delhi, Mumbai, and Hyderabad.

title: Britain's ex-prince Andrew arrested over misconduct amid Epstein row
content: Britain's Prince ex-Andrew has been arrested. He faces suspicion of misconduct in public office. This marks a significant development. The Duke of York has been living in Norfolk. Thames Valley Police confirmed the arrest. Searches are underway at multiple locations. The investigation is active. Prince Andrew has previously denied wrongdoing.

title: 'Appeasing policy': Why SC flagged 'freebies culture' and cautioned states
content: The Supreme Court expressed serious concerns over the growing culture of freebies in states, warning it could hamper economic development and strain finances. Justices questioned whether indiscriminate distribution of benefits, without distinguishing between the needy and others, amounts to an appeasing policy that could weaken work culture and development efforts.

title: 'Don't threaten people': Kerala BJP chief hits out at CM Vijayan over ‚ÄòThe Kerala Story 2‚Äô
content: Kerala BJP chief Rajeev Chandrasekhar has accused Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan of hypocrisy and distraction tactics over his opposition to 'The Kerala Story' sequel. Chandrasekhar asserted filmmakers' rights and citizens' freedom to watch, urging Vijayan to use legal channels instead of creating fear. Vijayan had earlier condemned the sequel as a bid to spread communal discord.

title: Cardi B refuses Stefon Diggs‚Äô attempts to reconnect after breakup
content: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B reportedly had a pretty dramatic break up as the New England Patriots' star player lost miserably at Super Bowl LX. As Cardi B seems to be busy touring the country, a new claim has been made about Stefon Diggs trying his best to win her back. But Cardi B has reacted pretty strongly to it.

title: 'Epstein sent woman, Andrew sent confidential docs': What police is probing against ex-UK prince
content: UK Police are investigating Prince Andrew for alleged misconduct in public office, focusing on his links with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Allegations include Epstein sending a woman to the UK for a sexual encounter with Andrew in 2010 and the Prince sharing confidential trade documents with Epstein while serving as a trade envoy.

title: Rajpal Yadav opens up about playing 500 roles and his strict no-abuse rule on screen
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav, known for his comic roles and honest reflections, discussed his career evolution and principles in a past interview. He emphasized his commitment to clean humor, shunning abusive language despite industry trends. Currently facing legal issues from a cheque bounce case, Yadav's past statements highlight his resilience and dedication to his craft.

title: Nifty50 ends below 25,500; BSE Sensex down over 1,200 points - top reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex tanked in trade on Thursday after three consecutive days of gains. While Nifty50 went below 25,450, BSE Sensex crashed over 1,400 points in intraday trade.

title: Nikhil Gupta, Pannun murder plot and the Nijjar connection: Inside a case that spanned 3 continents
content: Hardeep Singh Nijjar, a Khalistani separatist, was assassinated in Canada, sparking diplomatic tensions. Simultaneously, a plot to kill Gurpatwant Singh Pannun in the US was uncovered, leading to the arrest of Indian national Nikhil Gupta. US authorities allege an Indian government employee directed the plot, a claim India disputes, suggesting a rogue operation.

title: Emirates Mars Mission: UAE extends Hope Probe until 2028, new discoveries expected
content: The United Arab Emirates has extended its Emirates Mars Mission, the Hope Probe, through 2028, significantly beyond its original two-year operational timeline. This extension allows for continued study of Martian weather and atmospheric dynamics, contributing valuable data to global climate research and bolstering the UAE's growing space sector and future deep-space ambitions.

title: Bangladesh skies closed for SpiceJet: Here's why airline is barred by Dhaka
content: Bangladesh has barred SpiceJet from its airspace over unpaid dues, forcing the airline to reroute flights from Kolkata to northeastern cities like Guwahati.  While SpiceJet assures constructive engagement for resolution, the extended flight paths are impacting operations. This comes as the budget carrier recently reported a significant quarterly loss.

title: 'India used to fear us': Pakistan's Amir, Ali blast Shadab for digs at seniors
content: Mohammad Amir said Pakistan no longer commands the fear it did in the 1990s, especially against India. Shahid Afridi called for dropping senior players, which angered Shadab Khan, who reminded critics they also never beat India in World Cups. Basit Ali criticised Shadab‚Äôs comments and questioned his performances, sharing an anecdote about taking away his phones on a past tour.

title: ‚ÄòExpectations weighing him down‚Äô: Gavaskar reveals how Abhishek can survive T20 WC test
content: Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar believes pressure is affecting India's young opening batter Abhishek Sharma's T20 World Cup form, advising him to build his innings patiently rather than forcing big shots early.  He also praised Shivam Dube's explosive batting and highlighted Varun Chakravarthy's crucial role as a key bowler for India.

title: Rajasthan: Man detained for threatening to 'shoot' Rahul Gandhi & 25 other Congress MPs
content: A man identifying as a Karni Sena spokesperson was detained in Kota for allegedly uploading a video threatening to shoot Rahul Gandhi and 25 other Congress MPs. The threats were issued over alleged verbal abuse of Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla. Both BJP and Karni Sena have denied any association with the accused.

title: Deadly thread in the sky: Why Chinese manjha remains a killer
content: Chinese manjha, a sharp synthetic kite string, poses a deadly threat during Indian festivals, causing severe injuries and fatalities to motorcyclists and birds. Despite government bans and enforcement drives, its illegal sale persists, turning a cherished tradition into a recurring public safety crisis.

title: At AI Summit, PM Modi‚Äôs nameplate carries a ‚ÄòBharat‚Äô message
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the global community at the AI Impact Summit to leverage technological disruption as humanity's greatest opportunity, emphasizing "right action" guided by "right understanding." The summit also saw the country's nameplate displayed as "Bharat," a recurring practice at official global events, sparking renewed discussion.

title: From Gerald R Ford to INS Vikramaditya: A look at the world‚Äôs 10 biggest aircraft carriers
content: Aircraft carriers are powerful mobile airbases crucial for naval strategy, projecting power, and supporting diverse missions. From the technologically advanced USS Gerald R. Ford to the UK's Queen Elizabeth-class and Russia's Admiral Kuznetsov, these vessels showcase global naval capabilities and evolving designs.

title: Gold price today: Check rates of 18K, 22K and 24K gold in your city
content: Gold prices saw an upward trend on Thursday, with the April futures contract climbing Rs 365 to Rs 1,56,126 per 10 grams. This rise was fueled by fresh speculator buying and strong spot demand. Globally, New York gold futures also gained, reflecting a positive market sentiment.

title: Karachi gas explosion: 16 dead, several injured after illegal building collapse
content: A devastating gas explosion ripped through a residential building in Karachi's Soldier Bazaar early this morning, claiming at least 16 lives, including women and children. The blast caused a partial collapse of the ground-plus-two-storey structure, trapping victims under debris. Rescue efforts are underway, with authorities investigating the cause of the tragedy amidst ongoing concerns about building safety in the city.

title: Intruder breaks into Bengaluru home, slits woman‚Äôs throat as husband sleeps beside her
content: A 70-year-old woman was brutally murdered in her Bengaluru home while her mentally challenged husband lay beside her. Police arrested a wholesale shop owner, Shivakumar, alleging financial distress as the motive for the attack. Investigators believe the suspect sought gold ornaments and cash. CCTV footage and vehicle tracing led to the arrest.

title: Freed of murder charges after 43 yrs, why is Indian-origin man still not free in US?
content: An Indian-origin man, exonerated after 43 years in prison for a murder conviction overturned due to withheld evidence, now faces deportation. Despite his release from state prison, he was immediately taken into federal immigration custody, with bail denied due to a decades-old minor drug felony.

title: Abrahamic vs Islamic blocs: How India and Pakistan are reshaping UAE-Saudi split
content: Saudi Arabia and the UAE, once close allies, are now locked in open rivalry, impacting the Yemen war, cross-border trade, and regional flashpoints. This strategic split challenges core assumptions about Gulf stability and investor confidence. The dispute, fueled by economic competition and differing regional visions, is escalating with potential for proxy conflicts and business friction.

title: TCS-OpenAI Strategic Alliance: Tata Group IT major to build 100MW AI facility
content: Tata Consultancy Services has partnered with OpenAI to build AI infrastructure in India, aiming to enhance productivity and innovation. The collaboration will leverage OpenAI's enterprise ChatGPT and Codex tools, with TCS developing AI-ready, green energy-powered data centers. This strategic alliance seeks to position India as a global AI hub and empower its youth for the AI era.

title: T20 World Cup: Albie vs Morne Morkel alongside India vs South Africa in Super Eight
content: South Africa's specialist consultant Albie Morkel lightened the mood ahead of their UAE clash, joking about his brother Morne's role with India.  Albie's focus on yorkers and building confidence has bolstered the Proteas' formidable pace attack, with bowlers like Lungi Ngidi and Marco Jansen excelling.  He credits Stephen Fleming for shaping his player-centric coaching approach.

title: Now, domestic violence legal in Taliban-led Afghanistan ‚Äî as long as no ‚Äòbroken bones, open wounds‚Äô
content: Afghanistan's new penal code, signed by the Taliban's supreme leader, permits husbands to physically abuse wives and children without causing severe injury. It formalizes inequality, with different penalties for 'free' individuals and 'slaves.' Psychological and sexual violence against women are not explicitly prohibited, leaving them vulnerable and without adequate legal recourse.

title: T20 WC: Full Super 8 schedule with match timings and venues
content: The T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 stage is set with India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Zimbabwe, England, West Indies, New Zealand and South Africa qualifying. India topped Group A, while Australia were eliminated. The teams are split into two Super 8 groups, with fixtures across India and Sri Lanka from February 21 to March 1. The top two teams from each group will reach the semi-finals.

title: ‚ÄòAsked for details of pending dues‚Äô: Lucknow woman slaps, assaults electricity department employees
content: A woman allegedly stormed a Lucknow power substation, assaulting staff and tearing documents after her home's electricity was disconnected. Nidhi Sharma reportedly became agitated when asked for account details, leading to a physical altercation where employees were injured. Police have registered an FIR and are investigating.

title: 'Can I get a Shiv Shambhu?': Grammy winner SZA‚Äôs viral Mahashivratri moment at Isha Yoga Center
content: Grammy-winning artist SZA recently embarked on a personal spiritual journey in India, seeking stillness and balance beyond her demanding global career. Her visit included a silent retreat and participation in Mahashivratri at the Isha Yoga Center, showcasing a deep dive into mindfulness and cultural immersion.

title: Crosby 'by no means' out of Games, Cooper says
content: Canada is taking Sidney Crosby's injury "day by day," coach Jon Cooper says, as the team prepares for its Olympic semifinal against Finland.

title: Peterson's cramping exit draws Self's concern
content: Kansas freshman Darryn Peterson was limited to just the first three minutes of the second half against Oklahoma State with a cramping issue that coach Bill Self called concerning.

title: MLBPA elevates Meyer after Clark's resignation
content: The MLBPA has unanimously elected Bruce Meyer as its interim executive director following the resignation of Tony Clark.

title: 'Just relief': U.S. survives OT thriller to reach semis
content: The U.S. men are moving on to the semifinals at the Olympics thanks to Quinn Hughes, after needing extra hockey to get through the quarterfinals Wednesday against Sweden.

title: Report: Hornets' Ball uninjured after car crash
content: LaMelo Ball was not injured after being involved in a two-car crash in downtown Charlotte on Wednesday, a source told The Associated Press.

title: Rousey, Carano set for extensive testing for clash
content: Ronda Rousey and Gina Carano will undergo extensive medical and neurological testing ahead of their May 16 MMA comeback clash, according to the California State Athletic Commission.

title: Creighton's Dix stars vs. UConn after mom's death
content: Josh Dix scored 21 points to lead Creighton to a 91-84 win over No. 5 UConn on Wednesday night, two weeks after his mother died from colon cancer.

title: Arizona overcomes Dybantsa's 35, takes out BYU
content: No. 4 Arizona got back in the win column after back-to-back losses by overcoming AJ Dybantsa's 35-point night to defeat BYU 75-68.

title: üíç Team USA's Knight, Bowe get engaged in Milan
content: Knight and Bowe fell in love at the 2022 Games in Beijing and have brought their Olympic love story full circle.

content: After riding a four-game losing streak into February, the Terps have turned it around, winning four in a row.

title: Humility, charitable foundation keep Larry Fitzgerald grounded after HOF nod
content: "It's an amazing, amazing thing to be a Hall of Famer, but the light bill still came," Larry Fitzgerald said, keeping life in perspective.

title: No Crosby, no problem? What we learned in Canada's thrilling 4-3 win over Czechia
content: The overwhelming tournament favorites needed a late tying goal and overtime to win, but they made the semis.

title: How Premier League clubs are looking to the U.S. to raise transfer funds
content: With tighter financial regulations and rules on sponsors coming to the Premier League, clubs need new ways to raise cash. They're looking Stateside.

content: Nedum Onuoha reveals how players tend to react when their club changes its coach in the middle of the season.

content: We had a very entertaining week of first leg knockout playoff matches in UEFA Champions League! ESPN FC's writers pick out their highs and lows of the tournament to this point.

title: 25 years after his death, Earnhardt's presence lives on in Daytona
content: It's been 25 years since Dale Earnhardt tragically died in Daytona, but a quarter century after his passing, his legacy lives large throughout NASCAR.

content: Looking ahead to the next recruiting class, there are big commits poised for big things at the next level.

title: Hubballi: File special leave petition against High Court order allowing bike taxis, say driver unions to government
content: Allowing unauthorised bike taxis would not only endanger public safety but also increase the number of road accidents, they say.

title: ‚ÄòAssamese community‚Äô will become almost minority in 2027 Census: Himanta
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Sarma has earlier claimed on several occasions that the population of Muslims in the State would be almost equal to that of the Hindus by 2041 if the current growth rate continues

title: Watch: AI cannot be controlled by billionaires: U.N. chief
content: United Nations chief Antonio Guterres has warned that the future of artificial intelligence must not be left to ‚Äúthe whims of a few billionaires‚Äù as he addressed a global AI summit in India.

title: Lakhbir Landa gang claims responsibility for AAP sarpanch's murder in Punjab‚Äôs Tarn Taran
content: In the unverified post that surfaced on social media on Thursday (February 19), the Lakhbir Landa gang claimed it was behind Harbarinder Singh's killing.

title: Karnataka enters Ranji Trophy final, to face Jammu and Kashmir in title clash
content: Following their success in the 2013-14 season, Karnataka grabbed the Ranji, Irani and Vijay Hazare trophies in the 2014-15 season as well

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Traditional knowledge docketing system among proposals in draft Kerala Intellectual Property Rights Policy
content: The IPR policy is being revised after 18 years. While 2008 IPR policy sought to lay a ‚Äòfoundational vision‚Äô for democratising innovation and safeguarding community-held knowledge, the 2026 revision attempts to build on this legacy, responding to the shifts in global trade, digital transformation and biodiversity governance

title: Woman booked for misusing bank account in ‚Çπ70.85 lakh cyber fraud case
content: The Karnataka Cyber Command has intensified its statewide special drive against mule bank accounts and ‚Äúmule herders,‚Äù uncovering a large network involved in routing proceeds of cyber fraud across the State

title: ‚ÄòUnresolved boundary‚Äô between India and China causing difficulties in relations: General Naravane
content: Speaking at a literature festival in Dibrugarh, the former Army chief says it is possible to arrive at an agreement through negotiations over the boundary issue with China similar to the 2015 Land Boundary Agreement signed with Bangladesh; he emphasises that India will never tolerate ‚Äòunilateral use of force‚Äô by China along the Line of Actual Control (LAC)

title: Chander Kunj apartment owners resist move by army housing forum to opt out of tripartite agreements for appointing consultant, demolition contractor
content: Army Welfare Housing Organisation and Chander Kunj Army Towers Apartment  Owners Association clash over more issues, including green building and swimming pool matters

title: Bengaluru woman rescued by police seconds before drowning in Bellandur Lake
content: The 23-year-old woman called the emergency helpline Namma 112 stating that she intended to end her life due to distress caused by frequent domestic disputes with her husband, a water-tanker driver.

title: Karnataka RTC staff protest: Bus services 96% normal, says government
content: Of the 12,458 scheduled departures planned across KSRTC, BMTC, NWKRTC and KKRTC, 11,987 services were operated, achieving an overall operation rate of 96.22%.

title: Animal part in soft drink causes health scare in Tiruchi college
content: According to reports, the incident took place at the canteen of a government college in Tiruchi when the male students shared a bottle of the soft drink, and found what appeared to be the tail of a skink in the dregs

title: Man detained in Kota for threatening to shoot Rahul Gandhi, other Congress MPs
content: Kota Superintendent of Police (SP) Tejaswani Gautam told PTI that police took suo motu action and detained the accused at Borkheda police station

title: Srisailam gears up for Ugadi
content: While the festivities will start on March 16, devotees will start arriving to the temple town from the first week of March itself, the EO said

title: Delhi High Court seeks Kuldeep Sengar's stand on Unnao rape survivor's plea in custodial death case
content: A Bench of justices Navin Chawla and Ravinder Dudeja issued notice to Sengar and other convicts on the survivor's plea seeking condonation of a delay of over 1940 days in filing the appeal against the 2020 trial court order on conviction and sentencing.

title: Demands for bus stands, memorial buildings raised in T.N. Assembly
content: The Minister was responding to a question raised by Manithaneya Makkal Katchi leader and Papanasam MLA M.H. Jawahirullah, who demanded the construction of a bus stand at Ayyampettai and also at Swamimalai, one of the six abodes of Lord Muruga

title: Kerala ruling front and Opposition close ranks against film ‚ÄòThe Kerala Story 2‚Äô
content: The opposing political fronts have unanimously condemned the controversial movie as one that brazenly advances Sangh Parivar‚Äôs Hindu majoritarian agenda by demonising minorities, chiefly Muslims

title: Supreme Court to hear CAA petitions from May 5
content: Final hearing in Citizenship (Amendment) Act case to begin May 5; over 250 petitions challenge CAA and Rules

title: Damage to steel crash barrier raises safety concerns among motorists near Mutharasanallur
content: Hundreds of vehicles use this stretch of the busy Tiruchi-Karur Highway and railways had installed the steel barrier for about 1 km as a safety measure several years ago

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea for SIR of electoral rolls in poll-bound Assam
content: The PIL, filed by Mrinal Kumar Choudhary, challenged the EC's decision to conduct a standard Special Revision in Assam instead of the more rigorous SIR conducted in other States.

title: Watch: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs women paradox: Educated, but not employed? | Focus Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu has one of the highest rates of women‚Äôs education in India. The State leads in healthcare, financial inclusion, and even has all-women factories in the automobile and electric vehicle sectors. And yet, only about 1 in 3 educated women are employed. How can both realities exist at the same time?

title: Provide basic amenities to evicted people: Gauhati High Court tells Assam govt.
content: A total of 566 families have been living in a makeshift camp since their eviction in June 2025 from Hasila Beel in western Assam‚Äôs Goalpara district

title: From silence to statement: India‚Äôs stand on Israel‚Äôs West Bank actions
content: India has added its name to the list of countries criticising Israel for its unilateral measures on the West Bank.

title: Congress takes dig at PM Modi‚Äôs ‚ÄòMANAV‚Äô vision for AI
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday (February 19, 2026) unveiled the MANAV vision for a human-centric approach and use of the fast-emerging technology with emphasis on sovereignty and inclusivity

title: Tobacco farmers protest sharp fall in prices, auctions suspended in few places in Karnataka
content: Anticipating a dip in sales after the 40% tax hike, cigarette manufacturers are believed to have curtailed purchases, leading to price volatility

title: SC slams freebies culture, says States should provide employment
content: Top court says economic development gets hit with such largesse distribution and States should work to open avenues for employment instead of giving free food, cycles, electricity to everyone

title: Vijayakant‚Äôs soul will not forgive, says T.N. BJP after DMDK joins DMK-led alliance
content: The BJP also shared an old video of Vijayakant opposing the DMK-Congress alliance and said, ‚ÄúTill his last breath, he was opposed to the anti-Tamil DMK-Congress.‚Äù

title: NGT seeks comprehensive plan to prevent coastal erosion of Ghoramara Island; sets up  committee
content: The principal Bench of the NGT appointed a Joint Committee, which will collect all the relevant facts and will prepare a comprehensive plan for the protection of the mangrove forest

title: Mamata Banerjee‚Äôs ‚Äòbarging‚Äô into I-PAC raids site a ‚Äògross abuse‚Äô of power, ED tells Supreme Court
content: 'The manner of entry constituted a clear show of force and numerical strength, during which documents and incriminating material were forcibly taken over and removed from the premises, despite repeated requests by ED officers to refrain from doing so'

title: Supreme Court accepts filmmaker's withdrawal of Ghooskhor Pandat title, says 'sensibilities are fragile'
content: The plea had alleged that the movie title and storyline were prima facie offensive and derogatory, which portray the Brahmin community in a defamatory manner

title: Assembly segment-wise developmental plans are being prepared says Vizianagaram Collector
content: The constituency-wise developmental plans would enable the  government to select right industries and projects based on the availability of natural and human resources, says District Collector S. Ramasundar Reddy
